name: Hotel Griffon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent our Anniversary week-end at the Hotel Griffon. Exceptional guest service from the time we left our car to when we left two days later. Had a King View Room, which I highly recommend. Great views of the embarcadero and Bay Bridge. The room was well stocked. Lovely linens and towels. Turn down service with chocolates each night - wonderful touch. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For anyone who isn't familiar with this hotel, it is in the financial district of San Francisco which tends to be pretty deserted on the weekends. I think this hotel accommodates mostly business travelers. I stayed here with my girlfriend on a Saturday night for one night as we were attending a holiday party in the close by. The room was a little small but still very comfortable and it was charming in its own way with exposed brick. The main reason I recommend this hotel so highly is that the staff were consistently friendly and helpful during our short stay. I interacted with two different people at the friend desk and two different valet people and I would rate all four very highly. The people I interact with are really important to me so the smallness of the room can easily be overlooked.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, comfortable room, very good value

reviews.text: Hotel Griffon is by far one of the best hotels in San Francisco - bottom line. I travel quite a bit as I work for the Los Angeles Dodgers front office.....but also travel with friends and family. I have stayed in numerous spots throughout San Fran but no staff/hotel/location is better. The management staff (most notably GM Matt Swenson) is absolutely incredible and very helpful! And I couldn't pick a better location seeing as it is walking distance to the Embarcadero - Bart Station - restaurants - bars and trolley! The hotel itself is intimate and very clean.....some even with an amazing view of the bridge. All in all this place does not dissappoint and I will be staying here any time I am in the area. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Incredible Staff and Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for the lovely stay.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Stay & Great Location**

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is intimate & boutique in a very good location. We were unlucky to stay when there was a large convention in the city so bedroom rates were very expensive and this made us reduce the amount of nights we stayed in San Fran - We did pay a high price but for the location & facilities we were pleased. The bedroom was snug with no view but still very nice and clean.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff Member

reviews.text: This is a nice, rather hip little hotel facing the Embarcadero. The friendly staff was helpful and down to earth.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel on the Embarcadero.

reviews.text: My room was small like many of these older hotels that have been remade into boutiques but nicely appointed and clean as a whistle.
reviews.title: Simply. . . perfect!

reviews.text: Perry's restaurant in the hotel was great. Good chow, more than fair prices by SFO standards and very lively at night. Had breakfast at a table on the sidewalk and watched the sun rise behind the palms and the Bay Bridge. I paid 179 by booking last minute on the Hotels Tonight app for a Friday and Saturday night stay. I assume weekdays are more.
reviews.title: Good Place for a business trip.

reviews.text: I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel well positioned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but this stay was so perfect, I felt compelled to. I did receive an upgrade to an upper floor suite, so I don't know what my original room would have been like, but the entire experience was incredible anyway, so I don't think it would have mattered too much. I stayed one night after a Giants game, and the walk to AT&T was lovely. The view from my "upgrade" room was gorgeous, looking both south to the Bay Bridge and north to the Ferry Building! The room was beautifully appointed, from the polished wood floors in the sitting room to the copper sink in the dry bar area. I even noticed artful folding of the tissues and towels and appreciated an interesting environmentally-friendly hollow-core soap along with it's "window" box. Also, Perry's is great! At the bar I ordered fries and a totally crisp and "loaded" iceberg lettuce salad along with my wine, and enjoyed talking with Giants fans and observing other interesting tourists at the same time. The staff was so friendly and helpful, up early in the morning to provide great coffee in the lobby. For a special treat for Giants games (even without the upgrade) I will definitely stay there again and again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a little gem in San Francisco, the staff is very polite and attentive. I was pretty impressed with how nice they were. The room was small but very nice with a lot of charm. I will be staying here next time I come to San Franicisco.
reviews.title: Small But Quaint

reviews.text: We had a nice stay at Hotel Griffon. We would strongly recommend staying in a room with a view. The hotel is one block from Ferry building and we had nice time at the Saturday farmers market. The hotel even let us keep bikes In their office.
reviews.title: Great location! Great service!

reviews.text: Small (relatively - this is the US) and with extremely helpful staff, this boutique hotel delivered just what was required.
reviews.title: Perfect location and supreme comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was well equipped, blissfully quiet and with a supremely comfortable bed. Real coffee and tea within the room was a welcome bonus.
reviews.title: Super location, nice stay

reviews.text: The location means that walking to most of San Francisco's attractions is a realistic prospect and there is an amazing range of excellent eateries within range, including the in house Perrys.
reviews.title: Beware of the construction and club music!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night in early October and found the small room to be: dated, stifling, a fake window (best of my memory), thus, not a pleasant room to relax. The staff person who came to turned down the bed was friendly and pleasant. Our room was next to the elevator which kept us up. Positives are: walking distance to many locations and complimentary coffee and fruits in the morning. Valet parking is $40 per night. Overall I do not recommend staying except if you need a place to sleep and to be downtown.
reviews.title: Excellent location but dated

reviews.text: I had a fantastic experience at Hotel Griffon this past weekend. I was in town for a conference, so I needed a place to stay that was close to downtown, and was clean and relaxing. The hotel was really nice and the decor was beautiful throughout the lobby and guest rooms. My room was updated and clean, but ideal for a single person since the sink and vanity area was in the bedroom (while the toilet and shower had a separate area). I loved the exposed brick wall! The room was very small, but it was the perfect amount of space of me. I requested a bay view room, but they did not have any available, so when I opened my curtains I was staring at a brick wall and another guest room window. I kept the curtains closed because there wasn't a nice view and it didn't let in much light since I was on the second floor. I appreciated that I had my own AC unit in the room...it was a bit stuffy when I arrived and it was really helpful to cool it down and get some air circulating throughout. Finally, the food at Perry's was absolutely amazing (but a little pricey) and the room service was faster than I have ever experienced at any hotel, hands down. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to single travelers visiting the area and I will definitely stay here again when I am in SF -- but I will need a view of the bay.
reviews.title: Perfect for a single person.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfectly situated near the Pier and AT&T Stadium, this small boutique hotel has its charm. We booked a Deluxe Bay View King room. We were astonished at how small the room was for the astronomical amount we were charged. We had room 418. Although the view was nice (even with the Hotel sign outside our window, lighting up the word HO at night...) the layout was odd. The bathroom had a toilet and a shower. The sink was outside the bathroom at the foot of the bed. So ladies - if you are newly dating your fella, be prepared for him to see all the "magic" that normally goes on behind closed doors. You'll be blow drying your hair, brushing your teeth and doing whatever else you do to make yourself gorgeous right in front of him. There is no refrigerator in the room. Considering our room faced Embarcadero, the soundproofing was impressive, we didn't hear any traffic. The room would be perfect for a single business traveler with a large budget. Practice walking sideways before you go, both for your room and the tiny elevator.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: There is a bar/restaurant downstairs, Perry's. Book your dinner through the concierge and you'll get a great table. It is basically a sports bar, so be prepared for a lively crowd. The hotel is also flanked by two other restaurants, one a Japanese restaurant (which had a waiting list of 1 1/2 hours on Saturday night) and a French/Japanese fusion restaurant on the other side. When we couldn't get into the Japanese restaurant, the concierge walked us over to the other restaurant (whose name I've forgotten) and suddenly we had a window seat for two - very impressive.
reviews.title: Not what I expected
Not a good experience
reviews.text: If you are there on the weekend, go elsewhere for breakfast. When we arrived downstairs at Perry's at 8:15 a.m., we were told it would be another 20 minutes before it was open. We were seated, and served coffee at 8:30. At that time, the overhead speakers came blaring on, broadcasting depressing news. When we asked them to please turn the news off, the channel was changed to a loud rock station. I love rock, but not at 8:30 a.m. Two other tables also asked that the radio be turned off. Again, it was simply changed to a different channel, just as loud. Not exactly relaxing.

description: The Hotel Griffon, located on San Francisco's Embarcadero waterfront is just steps from the Ferry Building and Financial District and provides spectacular views of the San Francisco Bay Bridge in may of the rooms. With complimentary WiFi, a car service to downtown and on-site restaurant,the Hotel Griffon is the perfect boutique hotel for both business and leisure travel.
